ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] *Sigh*

ygData.messageBody:
--- In theeverquesttavern@y..., Tully Satre <rmstci@y...> wrote:
>
>
> Dont do it raven! E-Mail me all the information about your
computer. I would now isf something is wrong or you need a new
system. Before doing that you also must contact EQ i think about your
account so it doesn't get erased or something call (858) 537-0898
> I mainly want your Video card - Processor - computer company and
model - type - MHz or GHz amount - and any toher information about
the 3D thing. PLEASE Inform Me as Sooon as possible before going off
and buying a computer. If you have to buy a new computer, I suggest
selling the old one, to help contribute to it. A good computer yet
quite prcy is the new Area-51 AlienWare Computer. Inform me as soon
as possible! Thx! ~~~Ziward
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------
> Do You Yahoo!?
> Yahoo! Tax Center - online filing with TurboTax
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
Ok here are the specs (I think. Sorry I am not too computer swavey):

I know for a fact it has a pen II
umm..the processor? is that the chip? 200MHz..I think? Is that
written on the mother board itself? 'cause if it is I can check that
tomorrow night and post that for you.

It's a cobbled together computer so I really didn't buy it from a
store. (My friends helped me put it together after I smoke checked
the last hard drive.)

I have a 10G HD

56X CD-Rom

At the moment I have 230MB? of RAM. It uses some old mem chips and
SDRAM.

Now for the new vid card:
It's a Verto. Specs are: GeForce2 MX200 32MB SDRAM
2D/3D Graphics processor. It's AGP (The vid card I have in right now
is a PCI)

On the side of the box it says for minimum requirements:
Intel Pen II, 1 availabe AGP slot, 64MB Ram, CD-Rom Drive, 10MB
available disk space, Win 95/98 or higher, Win NT 4.0 with service
pack 5 or 6, and Linux OS

I've got all of that, I think. I don't know what these are:
Win NT 4.0 with service pack 5 or 6, and Linux OS
So I can't tell you if they are on my comp or not.


There's a store not too far from where I live that is really cool
about computers. Apparently they are buying computers all the time,
and of course selling them too. I went to Best Buy (As it is close to
where I live) and the cheapest system they have is for $599.00. That
is a bit out of my price range (LOL Like $300.00). And all of the
systems are Pen IV and have Win XP on them. I only want a Pen III and
I definatly want to keep Win 98!

I hope this info helps. Like I said, there is that computer store not
too far from here. A friend of mine is going to take me there this
Friday so I can check it out and see how cool they are. I'm sure that
there is going to be a price difference, but I don't know how much
since I want to keep my hard drive and mem sticks.
